title: Château Chantemerle 2015  Médoc
description: The 39-acre estate is under the same ownership as Château les Trois Manoirs. This wine has a generous use of wood that has nicely stopped short of smothering the fruit. While the wine offers plenty of spice and toast, it also offers juicy black currants and acidity. The two elements are coming together and the wine will be ready from 2023.

title: Château Croix du Trale 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This family-owned property lies in the north of the Haut-Médoc region, close to Saint-Estèphe. The wine, with 12 months in wood, has a spicy, toasty character although this doesn't lose the blackberry fruits and acidity. A ripe wine, it will become attractively fruity as it matures. Drink from 2024.

title: Château Dallau 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This estate in the northern vineyards of Bordeaux is planted to a blend of 75% Merlot and the two Cabernets. The wine has structure as well as rich berry fruits. Its tannins mark it out as still young, and this potentially ripe, warm wine should be drunk from 2019.

title: Château du Raux 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This spicy, toasty has the potential for bright berry fruits. With acidity as well as a dry structure, it will need aging. This family estate dates back to the 19th century. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Landat 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This light, fruity wine already has a good balance between bright fruits and the wood-aging. With black-currant flavors from the 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and spice from the 12 months wood aging, this wine is still structured and will be best from 2021.

title: Château Laride 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This spicy, juicy wine has black-currant fruitiness from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend. It is rich, the wood aging still showing in the toasty edge. With its lively fruit and soft tannins, it will develop well over the medium term. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Laujac 2015  Médoc
description: Owned by the Cruse family, one of Bordeaux's major negociants, this estate was their original purchase in Bordeaux. With more than 60% of Cabernet Sauvignon in the blend, this wine is packed with black currants and tannins in equal measure. As the wine softens, it will broaden out to emphasize its richness and the warm fruit. Drink from 2023.

title: Château le Chêne 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: A blend holding 55% Cabernet Sauvignon gives plenty of black currant fruit and provides the tannins that form the background to this richly juicy wine. Merlot adds weight to this perfumed, ripe wine that will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Château L'Oiseau 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine is generous, with red-berry and red-currant fruitiness. Its tannins still show some firmness although they are integrating well with the fruit and acidity. The wine will be ready to drink by mid-2018.

title: Château Méric 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This estate lies in the far western reaches of the Médoc close to the forest, giving a cool character to the wine. It obviously been wood-aged, although with room left for the blackberry fruits. Spice and toast flavors are already integrating well, indicating the wine's potential. Drink from 2023.

title: Château Ramafort 2015  Médoc
description: This structured wine comes from an estate that has records going back to the 13th century. A blend of half-and-half Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, it is firm and tannic at this young stage. The juicy black currant fruit is beginning to develop, bringing with it plenty of crisp acidity. Drink this wine from 2023.

title: Abadia Retuerta 2016 Le Domaine Blanco de Guarda Sauvignon Blanc (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León)
description: This Sauvignon Blanc from Ribera del Duero is not a normal Spanish white wine. For starters, it smells overly woody but under control. A thick, resiny palate is creamy and low on acidity. Flavors of woodspice, vanilla and resin are not the least bit fruity, and it's warm on the finish, with a creamy texture. Overall, this is more about the barrel than fruit.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León

title: Altos de Torona 2016 Rosal Caiño Albariño-Loureiro White (Rías Baixas)
description: This blend of three local grapes including Albariño opens with briny core aromas surrounded by white-fruit notes. The palate hits with a piercing shot of acidity but then turns thicker and more syrupy. Flavors of passion fruit and nectarine are slightly briny and finish plump.

title: Bèlon du Bèlon 2009 Pas Dosé Riserva  (Franciacorta)
description: The nose isn't very expressive but the palate offers mature yellow apple, bread crust and citrus alongside a note of honeyed nut. Bright acidity and small bubbles refresh the finish.

title: Château du Rocher 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is ripe and fruit forward. Its tannins are already softening leaving the crisp purity of black currant flavors. Drink early from 2022.

title: Château Cos d'Estournel 2017 Goulée by Cos d'Estournel Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Soft, perfumed and juicy, this is a ripe wine. Its generous texture and fine acidity are balanced by a smoky, chocolate and richly fruited finish.
designation: Goulée by Cos d'Estournel Barrel Sample

title: Château Crabitey 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Tight and tannic, this is a weighty and concentrated wine. Its rich berry fruits are integrated with the structure already, supplying fine fruitiness and crisp acidity.

title: Château d'Uza 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Smooth and generous, this is a round wine, full of blackberry fruits, soft tannins and light acidity. This rich wine will age quickly.

title: A Mano 2016 Primitivo (Puglia)
description: Fresh and floral on the nose, the palate is ripe in red berry flavors, balanced by streaks of granite. Vibrant acidity helps cut through some of the fruit weight. This is simplistic but easy to glug.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2014 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Oaky, rubbery aromas are stewy and include notes of clove and cinnamon. A raw, pulling palate is defined by rubbery tannins, while this wine is toasty on top of tart plum and black-currant flavors. A firm, tough finish holds leftover clove, toast and licorice flavors.

title: Acentor 2016 Garnacha (Calatayud)
description: Berry and tomato aromas are basic. Typical of Garnacha, this is grabby and chewy on the palate. Flavors of grape skins, black plum and herbal berry fruits are peppery and show a hint of oak-based clove on the finish.

title: Bèlon du Bèlon 2011 Pas Dosé Blanc 48 mesi  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of toasted bread crust and walnut follow through to the palate along with mature yellow apple skin and a hint of ripe lemon zest. An almond note gives it a bitter finish.

title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Pure and fresh notes of freshly cut Conference pear are immediately apparent. The same light, pure, fresh fruit plays on the slender, dry palate. This is an crowd-pleaser of a wine, with lovely balance.

title: Emile Beyer 2015 Eguisheim Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: The nose is ripe in aromas of red cherry and berry tones, while the palate is less expressive but presents a juicy, easy freshness on a light body. This will also work chilled. Drink soon.

title: Galil Mountain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Upper Galilee)
description: This wine features a bouquet of white peach and pink grapefruit. It offers a nice balance of fruit and floral flavors, with grapefruit, lemon and jasmine.

title: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Momi  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with aromas of black-skinned fruit, scorched soil and a hint of game. The firm palate offers black-currant jam, licorice and star anise alongside polished tannins.

title: I Pastini 2016 Antico White (Locorotondo)
description: A blend of 60% Verdeca, 35% Bianco d'Alessano and 5% Minutolo, this is a snappy, enjoyable wine, with aromas of ripe apple, pear and dried hay that echo on the palate. This shows a waxy feel that is cut by lively acidity on the midpalate. Enjoy with white fish or ceviche.

title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Muscat (Alsace)
description: This wine shows a perfumed nose of lemon, rose water and orange zest. On the palate pithy citrus counters the rose petal softness. There is just the slightest edge of bitterness on the light and resolutely dry palate.

title: Keswick Vineyards 2016 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Monticello)
description: This Cabernet Franc is abundant in aromas—vacillating from greener notes of tomato leaf and spearmint to jammy red currant, black plum and violets. The racy acidity is much needed to match the full body. Smooth tannins are well integrated and the finish is long and mouthwatering.

title: KWV 2015 Roodeberg Red (Western Cape)
description: This blend of 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Shiraz, 11% Merlot and 9% Petit Verdot offers massive black-plum character throughout the nose and mouth, as well as accents of black cherry, cassis, tobacco and woodspice. The medium tannins lend good grip to the palate, but resolve fairly quickly on the close. Notes of black currant leaf and fruit skin ride out the close. Enjoy now and through 2020.
